metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2375 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An exploitable out-of-bounds read exists in the handling of the MXIT protocol in Pidgin. Specially crafted MXIT contact information sent from the server can result in memory disclosure.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2375` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

finch - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
libpurple-bin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
libpurple0 - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
pidgin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
pidgin-data - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pidgin package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3').
